segments.text: do you mind if I sit here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , of course not . Go ahead .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yes , now that you mention it , I think we had a chemistry class together in high school .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: you're right ! How are you ? It's been a long time !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What did you do after high school ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I went straight to university afterwards . What about you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I took a year off to go travelling .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that sounds exciting . Where did you go ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I went all over the world . It was the best year of my life . Where did you go to school ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I went to a small school in Connecticut . It has a very good reputation for its languages department .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , did you study a foreign language ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yes , I got a grant to study Chinese .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's a very difficult language to learn , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it is , but it's very rewarding .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can , but not as well as I'd like to . I'll be studying Chinese until the day I die !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think most languages take a lifetime to learn well .
segments.speaker: S2
